# Install and load necessary packages
# install.packages(c("shiny", "ggplot2", "dplyr", "plotly", "tidyr"))
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(plotly)
library(tidyr)

# --- 1. Create the dataframe ---

df <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alexis-ribal/globaldatabarometer/refs/heads/main/data/gdbclusterswgi.csv")

# Combine lists
all_countries <- df$country
all_countrycodes <- df$countrycode


# Generate random values for gdb and all variables (0-100)
gdb_vars <- c("gdb_cc", "gdb_ci", "gdb_ea", "gdb_gf", "gdb_lm", "gdb_pf", "gdb_pi", "gdb_pp")
all_vars <- c("all_cc", "all_ci", "all_ea", "all_gf", "all_lm", "all_pf", "all_pi", "all_pp")
wgi_vars <- c("wgi_cc", "wgi_ge", "wgi_pv", "wgi_rl", "wgi_rq", "wgi_va")


# --- 2. Define UI for Shiny dashboard ---
ui <- fluidPage(
  # Add a title to the dashboard
  titlePanel(
    h1("Country benchmarking tool of the Global Data Barometer 2nd Edition data", align = "left", style = "color: #2c3e50; font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 20px;")
  ),
  
  # Layout with 3 columns
  fluidRow(
    # First column for controls (20% width)
    column(2,
           style = "background-color: #f8f9fa; padding: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);",
           h4("Dashboard Controls", style = "color: #34495e; margin-bottom: 20px;"),
           selectInput("selected_country",
                       label = "Select country:",
                       choices = all_countries,
                       selected = all_countries[1]
           ),
           selectInput("comparison_country",
                       label = "Select comparison country:",
                       choices = all_countries,
                       selected = all_countries[3]
           ),
           selectInput("selected_gdb_cluster",
                       label = "Select cluster:",
                       choices = c(
                         "Critical Competences" = "gdb_cc",
                         "Company Information" = "gdb_ci",
                         "Equitable Access" = "gdb_ea",
                         "Governance Foundation" = "gdb_gf",
                         "Land Management" = "gdb_lm",
                         "Public Finance" = "gdb_pf",
                         "Political Integrity" = "gdb_pi",
                         "Public Procurement" = "gdb_pp"
                       ),
                       selected = "gdb_cc"
           ),
           selectInput("selected_wgi_indicator",
                       label = "Select Worldwide Governance Indicator:",
                       choices = c(
                         "Control of Corruption" = "wgi_cc",
                         "Government Effectiveness" = "wgi_ge",
                         "Political Stability and Absence of Violence" = "wgi_pv",
                         "Rule of Law" = "wgi_rl",
                         "Regulatory Quality" = "wgi_rq",
                         "Voice and Accountability" = "wgi_va"
                       ),
                       selected = "wgi_ge"
           ),
           hr(), # Horizontal line for separation
           div(
             h5("Sources:", style = "color: #34495e;"),
             tags$ul(
               tags$li(tags$a(href = "https://globaldatabarometer.org/", "The Global Data Barometer 2nd Edition", target = "_blank")),
               tags$li(tags$a(href = "https://www.worldbank.org/en/publication/worldwide-governance-indicators", "Worldwide Governance Indicators, 2024 Update, World Bank", target = "_blank"))
             )
           ),
           hr(), # Horizontal line for separation
           div(
             h5("Metadata:", style = "color: #34495e;"),
             tags$ul(
               tags$li(tags$a(href = "https://github.com/alexis-ribal/globaldatabarometer/", "Notes", target = "_blank")),
               tags$li(tags$a(href = "https://alexis-ribal.github.io/", "Author", target = "_blank"))
             )
           ),
           div(
             style = "text-align: center; margin-top: 20px;",
             tags$a(href = "https://www.epsilonmas.com/", target = "_blank", # Replace with your desired URL
                    tags$img(src = "https://i.ibb.co/s9ZFsPqs/Epsilonmas.png", style = "max-width: 100%; height: auto;")
             )
           )
    ),
    
    # Second column for Quadrants A and B (40% width)
    column(5,
           # Quadrant A
           div(
             style = "background-color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); height: 450px;",
             plotlyOutput("quadrantA_chart", height = "100%") # Set height to 100%
           ),
           # Quadrant B
           div(
             style = "background-color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); height: 450px;",
             plotlyOutput("quadrantB_chart", height = "100%") # Set height to 100%
           )
    ),
    
    # Third column for Quadrants C and D (40% width)
    column(5,
           # Quadrant C
           div(
             style = "background-color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); height: 450px;",
             plotlyOutput("quadrantC_chart", height = "100%") # Set height to 100%
           ),
           # Quadrant D
           div(
             style = "background-color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); height: 450px;",
             plotlyOutput("quadrantD_chart", height = "100%") # Set height to 100%
           )
    )
  ),
  # Custom CSS for better aesthetics and responsiveness
  tags$head(
    tags$style(HTML("
      body {
        font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
        background-color: #ecf0f1;
        color: #34495e;
      }
      .container-fluid {
        padding: 30px;
      }
      .col-sm-2, .col-sm-5 {
        padding: 15px;
      }
      .shiny-input-container {
        margin-bottom: 15px;
      }
      .selectize-input {
        border-radius: 5px;
        border: 1px solid #ccc;
      }
      .selectize-dropdown {
        border-radius: 5px;
      }
      h1, h4, h5 {
        margin-top: 0;
      }
      /* Ensure plot legends and titles are responsive */
      .plotly .legend .text {
        font-size: 0.8em !important; /* Adjust as needed */
      }
      .plotly .gtitle {
        font-size: 1.2em !important; /* Adjust as needed */
      }
      @media (max-width: 768px) {
        .col-sm-2, .col-sm-5 {
          width: 100%;
        }
        .container-fluid {
          padding: 15px;
        }
      }
    "))
  )
)

# --- 3. Define server logic ---
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  
  # Update choices for comparison country to exclude selected country
  observe({
    current_selected_country <- input$selected_country
    # Filter out the currently selected country from the comparison list
    available_comparison_countries <- all_countries[all_countries != current_selected_country]
    updateSelectInput(session, "comparison_country",
                      choices = available_comparison_countries,
                      selected = available_comparison_countries[1] # Set a default if the current selection is removed
    )
  })
  
  # Reactive expression for the main selected country's data
  selected_country_data <- reactive({
    req(input$selected_country)
    df %>% filter(country == input$selected_country)
  })
  
  # Reactive expression for the comparison country's data
  comparison_country_data <- reactive({
    req(input$comparison_country)
    df %>% filter(country == input$comparison_country)
  })
  
  # Reactive expression for GDB cluster full name
  gdb_cluster_name <- reactive({
    switch(input$selected_gdb_cluster,
           "gdb_cc" = "Critical Competences",
           "gdb_ci" = "Company Information",
           "gdb_ea" = "Equitable Access",
           "gdb_gf" = "Governance Foundation",
           "gdb_lm" = "Land Management",
           "gdb_pf" = "Public Finance",
           "gdb_pi" = "Political Integrity",
           "gdb_pp" = "Public Procurement",
           "Unknown Cluster"
    )
  })
  
  # Reactive expression for WGI indicator full name
  wgi_indicator_name <- reactive({
    switch(input$selected_wgi_indicator,
           "wgi_cc" = "Control of Corruption",
           "wgi_ge" = "Government Effectiveness",
           "wgi_pv" = "Political Stability and Absence of Violence",
           "wgi_rl" = "Rule of Law",
           "wgi_rq" = "Regulatory Quality",
           "wgi_va" = "Voice and Accountability",
           "Unknown Indicator"
    )
  })
  
  # --- Quadrant A: How X scores against the world? ---
  output$quadrantA_chart <- renderPlotly({
    req(selected_country_data())
    data_qA <- selected_country_data() %>%
      select(all_of(gdb_vars), all_of(all_vars)) %>%
      pivot_longer(
        cols = starts_with("gdb_") | starts_with("all_"),
        names_to = c(".value", "category"),
        names_pattern = "(gdb|all)_(.*)"
      ) %>%
      mutate(
        deviation = gdb - all,
        category_label = case_when(
          category == "cc" ~ "Critical Competences",
          category == "ci" ~ "Company Information",
          category == "ea" ~ "Equitable Access",
          category == "gf" ~ "Governance Foundation",
          category == "lm" ~ "Land Management",
          category == "pf" ~ "Public Finance",
          category == "pi" ~ "Political Integrity",
          category == "pp" ~ "Public Procurement",
          TRUE ~ category
        )
      ) %>%
      arrange(deviation) # Order for better visualization
    
    p <- ggplot(data_qA, aes(x = deviation, y = reorder(category_label, deviation),
                             text = paste("Category:", category_label, "\nDeviation:", round(deviation, 2),
                                          "\nGDB Score:", round(gdb, 2), "\nAll Score:", round(all, 2)))) +
      geom_bar(stat = "identity", aes(fill = deviation > 0)) +
      scale_fill_manual(values = c("TRUE" = "#2ecc71", "FALSE" = "#e74c3c")) +
      labs(x = "Points difference from the overall score (- / +)", y = NULL, fill = "Positive Deviation") +
      theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        legend.position = "none", # Removed legend
        plot.title = element_text(size = rel(1.2)),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = rel(0.9)),
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = rel(0.9))
      )
    
    ggplotly(p, tooltip = "text") %>%
      layout(
        title = list(text = paste("Panel A: How", input$selected_country, "scores against overall scores?"), font = list(size = 14)), # Title is handled by renderText
        margin = list(t = 80) # Add top margin for blank space above title
      )
  })
  
  # --- Quadrant B: How X scores in Y? (Density Plot) ---
  output$quadrantB_chart <- renderPlotly({
    req(input$selected_gdb_cluster, selected_country_data())
    
    selected_gdb_col <- input$selected_gdb_cluster
    country_score <- selected_country_data()[[selected_gdb_col]]
    
    # Create a temporary dataframe for plotting with tooltip text
    plot_data_qB <- df %>%
      mutate(
        tooltip_text = paste0("Country: ", country,
                              "\n", gdb_cluster_name(), ": ", round(.data[[selected_gdb_col]], 2))
      )
    
    p <- ggplot(plot_data_qB, aes_string(x = selected_gdb_col)) +
      geom_density(fill = "#3498db", alpha = 0.6) +
      # Add invisible points for tooltips, mapping the pre-calculated text
      geom_point(aes(y = 0, text = tooltip_text), alpha = 0, size = 0.1) + # y=0 to place them on the axis
      geom_vline(xintercept = country_score, color = "#e74c3c", linetype = "dashed", size = 1) +
      labs(x = paste(gdb_cluster_name(), "score"), y = "Density") +
      xlim(0, 100) + # Ensure x-axis is always 0-100
      theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        legend.position = "bottom",
        plot.title = element_text(size = rel(1.2)),
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = rel(0.9)),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = rel(0.9)),
        legend.text = element_text(size = rel(0.8))
      )
    
    ggplotly(p, tooltip = "text") %>%
      layout(
        title = list(text = paste0("Panel C: How ", input$selected_country, " scores in ", gdb_cluster_name(), "?"), font = list(size = 14)), # Title is handled by renderText
        annotations = list(
          x = country_score, y = 0, # Position of the annotation
          text = paste0(input$selected_country,": ", round(country_score, 2)),
          xref = "x", yref = "paper", showarrow = TRUE, arrowhead = 7, ax = 0, ay = -40,
          font = list(color = "#e74c3c", size = 10)
        ),
        margin = list(t = 80) # Add top margin for blank space above title
      )
  })
  
  # --- Quadrant C: How X compares with Z? (Scatterplot GDB variables) ---
  output$quadrantC_chart <- renderPlotly({
    req(selected_country_data(), comparison_country_data())
    
    main_country_data <- selected_country_data() %>%
      select(all_of(gdb_vars)) %>%
      pivot_longer(
        cols = starts_with("gdb_"),
        names_to = "variable",
        values_to = "main_score"
      )
    
    comp_country_data <- comparison_country_data() %>%
      select(all_of(gdb_vars)) %>%
      pivot_longer(
        cols = starts_with("gdb_"),
        names_to = "variable",
        values_to = "comp_score"
      )
    
    plot_data_qC <- inner_join(main_country_data, comp_country_data, by = "variable") %>%
      mutate(
        variable_label = case_when(
          variable == "gdb_cc" ~ "Critical Competences",
          variable == "gdb_ci" ~ "Company Information",
          variable == "gdb_ea" ~ "Equitable Access",
          variable == "gdb_gf" ~ "Governance Foundation",
          variable == "gdb_lm" ~ "Land Management",
          variable == "gdb_pf" ~ "Public Finance",
          variable == "gdb_pi" ~ "Political Integrity",
          variable == "gdb_pp" ~ "Public Procurement",
          TRUE ~ variable
        ),
        # Use variable_label for the geom_text label
        label_text = variable_label,
        # Determine if point is above or below 45-degree line
        position_relative_to_line = ifelse(main_score > comp_score, "Above Line", "Below Line")
      )
    
    p <- ggplot(plot_data_qC, aes(x = main_score, y = comp_score,
                                  text = paste("Category:", variable_label, # Tooltip still uses variable_label
                                               "\n", input$selected_country, "Score:", round(main_score, 2),
                                               "\n", input$comparison_country, "Score:", round(comp_score, 2)),
                                  color = position_relative_to_line)) + # Color based on position
      geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.8) +
      geom_text(aes(label = label_text), nudge_x = 3, nudge_y = 3, size = 3, color = "#555555") + # Add labels
      geom_abline(intercept = 0, slope = 1, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray") + # 45-degree line
      scale_color_manual(values = c("Above Line" = "#2ecc71", "Below Line" = "#e74c3c")) + # Custom colors
      labs(x = paste(input$selected_country, "GDB Score"),
           y = paste(input$comparison_country, "GDB Score"),
           color = "Position relative to 45Â° line") + # Legend title
      xlim(0, 100) +
      ylim(0, 100) +
      theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        legend.position = "none", # Removed legend
        plot.title = element_text(size = rel(1.2)),
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = rel(0.9)),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = rel(0.9))
      )
    
    # For plotly, geom_text labels usually don't get tooltips unless explicitly mapped in aes and included in tooltip
    # We only want tooltips for the points, which is handled by 'text' aesthetic in geom_point.
    ggplotly(p, tooltip = "text") %>%
      layout(
        title = list(text = paste0("Panel B: How ", input$selected_country, " compares with ", input$comparison_country, "?"), font = list(size = 14)), # Title is handled by renderText
        margin = list(t = 80) # Add top margin for blank space above title
      )
  })
  
  # --- Quadrant D: How X scores compare to WGI (Scatterplot GDB vs WGI) ---
  output$quadrantD_chart <- renderPlotly({
    req(input$selected_gdb_cluster, input$selected_wgi_indicator, selected_country_data())
    
    selected_gdb_col <- input$selected_gdb_cluster
    selected_wgi_col <- input$selected_wgi_indicator
    
    plot_data_qD <- df %>%
      mutate(
        is_selected = (country == input$selected_country),
        tooltip_text = paste0("Country: ", country,
                              "\n", gdb_cluster_name(), ": ", round(.data[[selected_gdb_col]], 2),
                              "\n", wgi_indicator_name(), ": ", round(.data[[selected_wgi_col]], 2)),
        # Create a label for the selected country only, directly using the country name
        country_label = ifelse(is_selected, country, NA)
      )
    
    p <- ggplot(plot_data_qD, aes_string(x = selected_gdb_col, y = selected_wgi_col,
                                         color = "is_selected",
                                         text = "tooltip_text")) + # Use the new tooltip_text column
      geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.8) +
      # Add label for the selected country, using the 'country_label' which is the country name
      geom_text(aes(label = country_label), nudge_x = 0.5, nudge_y = 0.5, size = 3, color = "#e74c3c") +
      scale_color_manual(values = c("TRUE" = "#e74c3c", "FALSE" = "#3498db"),
                         labels = c("TRUE" = "Selected Country", "FALSE" = "Other Countries")) +
      labs(x = paste(gdb_cluster_name(),"score"), y = paste(wgi_indicator_name(),"score"), color = "Country Type") +
      xlim(0, 100) + # GDB axis
      ylim(-2, 2) + # WGI axis
      theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        legend.position = "none", # Removed legend
        plot.title = element_text(size = rel(1.2)),
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = rel(0.9)),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = rel(0.9))
      )
    
    ggplotly(p, tooltip = "text") %>%
      layout(
        title = list(text = paste0("Panel D: How ", input$selected_country, " GDB scores compare to WGI scores?"), font = list(size = 14)), # Title is handled by renderText
        margin = list(t = 80) # Add top margin for blank space above title
      )
  })
}

# Run the application
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
